    Run Taxon Profiles

    run_txprofile.Rd

    Load data needed and run or update demographic analyses for the list of species selected

    run_txprofile(
  Taxa,
  SpeciesList,
  ZIMSDir,
  AnalysisDir,
  PlotDir,
  ExtractDate,
  MinDate = "1980-01-01",
  Sections,
  ErasePrevious = FALSE,
  SexCats = c("Male", "Female"),
  MinBirthDate = "1900-01-01",
  InParallel = FALSE,
  ipara = 1,
  npara = 1,
  MinN = 50,
  MaxOutl = 99,
  spOutLev = NULL,
  Global = TRUE,
  UncertBirth = 365,
  UncertDeath = 365,
  UncertDate = 365,
  MinNSur = 50,
  MaxNSur = NULL,
  MinInstitution = 2,
  MinLx = 0.1,
  MinBirthKnown = 0.3,
  MaxAge = 120,
  MinMLE = 0.1,
  MaxLE = 2,
  MinAge = 0,
  ModelsSur = "GO",
  Shape = "bathtub",
  niter = 25000,
  burnin = 5001,
  thinning = 20,
  nchain = 3,
  ncpus = 2,
  RepSect = c("agemat", "litter"),
  BirthType = "Captive",
  LastDead = FALSE,
  ParentPercSire = 80,
  ParentPercDam = 80,
  MinNLitter = 20,
  NDay = 7,
  MinNRepro = 100,
  MinNPaRepro = 30,
  MinNSeas = 50,
  MinNGro = 100,
  MinNIGro = 50,
  MeasureType = "Live weight",
  ModelsGro = "vonBertalanffy"
)

    Arguments

    Taxa

    character Name of the taxa studied

    SpeciesList

    vector of character Species selected

    ZIMSDir

    character Directory where to find data

    AnalysisDir

    character Directory where to save results

    PlotDir

    character Directory to save the plots. Default: no plot is saved

    ExtractDate

    character 'YYYY-MM-DD' Date of data extraction

    MinDate

    character 'YYYY-MM-DD' Earliest date to include data

    Sections

    vector of character Names of the sections to update in the results: "sur", "rep" and/or "gro".

    ErasePrevious

    logical Whether the current result file should be deleted (before being replaced).

    SexCats

    character Male, Female or All.

    MinBirthDate

    character: Earliest possible date: date used when minimum birth or death dates are unknown

    InParallel

    logical Whether this function is run in parallel on different computers. In other words: should the species list be divided?

    ipara

    numeric ID number of the computer used

    npara

    numeric Number of computers used in parallel

    MinN

    numeric Minimum number of individuals needed to run the analysis.

    MaxOutl

    numeric Start threshold to select individuals based on the longevity distribution: 100%, 99.9, 99 or 95%. This number must decrease when many errors are expected in longevity data.

    spOutLev

    vector of character List of species for which the Maximum threshold for the longevity distribution is 99.9% instead of MaxOutl.

    Global

    logical Whether only individuals belonging to global collections should be used.

    UncertBirth

    numeric: Maximum uncertainty accepted for birth dates, in days

    UncertDeath

    numeric: Maximum uncertainty accepted for death dates, in days.

    UncertDate

    numeric: Maximum uncertainty accepted for measurement dates: weight, in days.

    MinNSur

    numeric Minimum number of individual records to run the survival analysis.

    MaxNSur

    numeric Maximum number of individual records to run the survival analysis.

    MinInstitution

    numeric Minimum number of institutions that should hold records to run the analyses.

    MinLx

    numeric Value used for longevity threshold and for checks. between 0 and 1. Minimum reached survivorship from the raw Kaplan Meier analysis. This number avoids running survival analysis if there are too few dead individuals in the data. Lower is better.

    MinBirthKnown

    numeric between 0 and 1. Minimum proportion of individuals with a known birth month in the data.

    MaxAge

    numeric Maximum possible age in years. Only used for model predictions. This argument is not used to select data.

    MinMLE

    numeric Value used for checks. Minimum survivorship allowed at mean life expectancy. Between 0 and 1.

    MaxLE

    numeric Value used for checks. Maximum remaining life expectancy at last observed age. In years.

    MinAge

    numeric Ages at which the analyses should start. see ?basta for more information.

    ModelsSur

    vector of characters names of the survival basta models to run: "G0", "EX", "LO" and/or "WE". see ?basta for more information.

    Shape

    character Shape of the survival basta model to run: "simple", "Makeham", "bathtub". see ?basta for more information.

    niter

    numeric. Number of MCMC iterations to run the survival model. see ?basta for more information.

    burnin

    numeric Number of iterations removed so that the survival model has time to converge. see ?basta for more information.

    thinning

    numeric Number of iteration to run the survival model before saving a set of parameters. see ?basta for more information.

    nchain

    numeric Number of chains to run the survival model.

    ncpus

    numeric Number of computer core to use.

    RepSect

    character Names of the reproductive analyses to run: "agemat", "litter" and/or ...

    BirthType

    character Captive, Wild, or All.

    LastDead

    logical Whether the longest lived individual should be considered dead.

    ParentPercSire

    numeric Minimum percentage of parentage probability to include Sire.

    ParentPercDam

    numeric Minimum percentage of parentage probability to include Dam.

    MinNLitter

    numeric Minimum number of litters to run the analysis. The data frame for litter size will be produced in all cases.

    NDay

    numeric Number of consecutive days over which the birth dates of a litter/clutch can be spread

    MinNRepro

    numeric Minimum number of birth records needed to run reproductive analyses.

    MinNPaRepro

    numeric Minimum number of unique parent records needed to run reproductive analyses.

    MinNSeas

    numeric XXXXXXXXXXX

    MinNGro

    numeric Minimum number of weight needed to fit the growth models

    MinNIGro

    numeric Minimum number of unique individuals needed to fit the growth models

    MeasureType

    vector of characters Names of the types of measurement that should be included. Default: all measurement type are included.

    ModelsGro

    vector of characters Names the growth models that need to be fit.The following models are supported : logistic, gompertz, chapmanRichards, vonBertalanffy, polynomial. default = "vonBertalanffy"

    Value

    Save and replace the result file for each species in the list. The file is saved in AnalysisDir/Rdata/Taxa_species.Rdata

    Examples

    # Here is an example but use directly your own ZIMSDir (directory to find data) 
# and AnalysisDir (directory to save the analysis)
file = system.file("sci_Animal.csv", package = 'ISRverse')
ZIMSDir = dirname(file)
AnalysisDir = paste0(tempdir(check = TRUE),'/temp')
PlotDir = paste0(AnalysisDir,'/plot')
# dir.create(AnalysisDir)
dir.create(paste0(AnalysisDir,'/Rdata'), recursive = TRUE)
dir.create(PlotDir)

#This code run the survival analysis
run_txprofile(Taxa = "Reptilia", SpeciesList = "All",
              ZIMSDir = ZIMSDir, AnalysisDir = AnalysisDir,
              PlotDir = PlotDir,
              ExtractDate = "",
              MinDate = "1980-01-01",
              Sections = c("sur"),
              SexCats = c('Male', 'Female'),
              niter = 1000, burnin = 101, thinning = 10, nchain = 3, ncpus = 3
)
#> Loading Data

list.files(PlotDir)
#> [1] "Long_dist" "Survival" 
list.files(paste0(AnalysisDir,'/Rdata'))
#> [1] "Reptilia_Testudo_hermanni.RData"

unlink(AnalysisDir, recursive = TRUE)
unlink(PlotDir, recursive = TRUE)
